Label:
## Issue civil court proceedings
### Who can use this service
Use this service if you are representing a Claimant and:
* bringing a claim for damages
* able to pay the full issue fee using Payment by Account

### About the Claimant
 The Claimant must: 
* have an address in England or Wales 
* have a litigation friend who can provide a certificate of suitability if they are under 18 
* not be a protected party as defined in CPR 21.1(2)(d)
* not have an all proceedings order, civil proceedings order, or civil restraint order in force against them

### About the Defendant 
The Defendant must (as far as the Claimant is aware):
* have a postal address for service in England or Wales
* be aged 18 years or older
* not be a protected party

### About the claim
A County Court damages claim is only suitable for the pilot if it:
* would not ordinarily follow the Part 8 procedure
* is not made under one of the provisions of the Consumer Credit Act 1974 specified in Civil Procedure Rules PD 7B paragraph 3.1
* is conducted in English

### You don't have a registered PBA. ### This case will not be saved. ## Register an existing PBA with MyHMCTS If you want to pay with a different PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk to ask for your PBA to be registered with your MyHMCTS account. You should include your organisation name and PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for your account to be updated. You’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee. ## Apply to get a new PBA You can use this form to apply for a new PBA account. You’ll need to provide details for you and your organisation, including the required credit limit for your account. Once your account has been registered, you’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee. Read more information on registering a PBA.

Label:
Pay with another PBA
## If there’s 1 PBA listed If you want to pay with a different PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk to ask for your PBA to be registered with your MyHMCTS account. You should include your organisation name and PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for your account to be updated. You’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee. ## If there are 2 PBAs listed You won’t be able to add another PBA. You can only submit this case online using one of the PBAs from the menu. If you want to remove a PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk. You should include the PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for the PBA to be removed. We’ll send you confirmation. Select ‘cancel’ below to discard the case.

Label:
## Issue civil court proceedings
To use this service you must be:
* issuing a claim for a specified (fixed) amount of money
* have an address in England or Wales and an email address
* able to pay the full issue fee using fee account
* serving a claim form in English

The claimant must:

* have an address in England or Wales
* not have a civil proceedings order, civil restraint order, or all proceedings order against them

The claim you’re issuing must not:
* ordinarily follow the Part 8 procedure
* be brought under the Consumer Credit Act 1974
* be against the Crown

## Legal representatives: specified civil money claims service ### Before you start Download and complete the claim timeline template with all events in your timeline. You will upload the template in this service. claim timeline template. You can complete and upload as many templates as necessary to record all events in your timeline. You can also manually enter your timeline in this service without using the template. If you're claiming interest you will need your interest calculation and dates.

## Email for defendant’s legal representative Use the email address of the legal representative's firm if you have it, otherwise use their personal email.

You can still issue the claim without their email address but the claim will then continue offline.

## Describe your claim
Do not give us a detailed timeline - we'll ask for that separately.

## Upload supporting documents (optional)
You can upload documents in support of the claim details above.
Upload file
HintText: We accept documents in these formats: pdf, txt, doc, dot, docx, rtf, xlt, xlsx, jpg, jpeg or png

Label: ## How do you want to add your claim timeline?

## Claim timeline
If you do not know the exact date, tell us the month and year.
### Example timeline
* 12 January 2020 - John Smith gave me a quote to replace the roof.
* 14 January 2021 - We agreed and signed a contract for the work.
* 21 March 2021 - I noticed a leak on the landing and told Mr Smith about this.

How interest to date is calculated

For most types of debt the rate is usually 8%.

To calculate this, we use the steps below.

  1. Work out the yearly interest: take the amount you’re claiming and multiply it by 0.08 (which is 8%).

  2. Work out the daily interest: divide your yearly interest from step 1 by 365 (the number of days in a year).

  3. Work out the total amount of interest: multiply the daily interest from step 2 by the number of days the debt has been overdue.

EXAMPLE
  1. The rate of annual interest is 8%.
  2. Annual interest on, for example, £1,000 is £80 (1000 x 0.08)
  3. Daily interest on £1,000 is 22p (80 / 365)
  4. Total amount of interest on £1,000 for 2 days is 44p (80 x 2 / 365)

There may be additional fees as your case progresses. There may be additional fees as your case progresses.

## List your evidence
Tell us about any evidence you wish to provide. You do not need to send us any evidence now. If your case goes to a court hearing, and is not settled, you will need to provide evidence.

## Claim Amount
 Your claim can be for single or multiple amounts. Do not include interest or the claim fee, you can add these on the next page.
## Do you want to claim interest?
You can claim interest on the money your client is owed. The court will decide if they’re entitled to it.

Help with interest rates
You can claim 8% interest on money owed to you. This is the statutory rate. If you know that a different rate applies you can use that. For example, if you have a contract with a specific rate. The court will decide if you're entitled to some, or all, of the interest claimed.
## How do you want to claim interest?

## What annual rate of interest do you want to claim?
 You can claim 8% per year unless you know that a different rate applies

Help with interest rates
You can claim 8% interest on money owed to you. This is the statutory rate. If you know that a different rate applies you can use that. For example, if you have a contract with a specific rate. The court will decide if you're entitled to some, or all, of the interest claimed.

## What is the total interest for your claim?
 Calculate interest for different periods of time, or items, and let us know the total. We’ll add it to your claim amount.
Show how you calculated the amount

## When are you claiming interest to?

You can only submit this case online using one of the PBAs from the menu. To remove a PBA, email: MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk. Include the PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for the PBA to be removed. We’ll send you confirmation.
